intro: Potentilla argentea var. acutifida, commonly known as silver cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Asia and North America. It is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a low-growing shrub with a compact form, often reaching heights of 15–30 cm. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and naturalized landscapes.
